sentences.english: Whisky is a general term describing many spirits.
sentences.chinese: 威士忌总括起来是描述一些烈酒。

sentences.english: Christ's remarkable words concerning Himself were a summary of all He had been saying for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 基督把他一直以来预言自己的话总括起来。

sentences.english: In conclusion, are you satisfied with the use of land for development of WKCD?
sentences.chinese: 总括而言，您满意西九龙文化区发展土地规划用途吗？

sentences.english: When the insurance policy matures, the insured person will receive the capital sum agreed.
sentences.chinese: 保险单到期时，投保人会得到一笔总括性付款。

sentences.english: Finally sum up contemporary staff education and training characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 最后总括当代员工教育和培训的特点。

sentences.english: Generally to say, is enthusiastic pursuit of the world in general.
sentences.chinese: 总括地说，世人一般所热心的是沽名钓誉。

definition: same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
(often used in book or chapter titles) general introduction/overview
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
to take a broad view of sth
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
